meanings.definition: To give strength or energy to
meanings.sent1: Drinking a nutritious smoothie can tonify your body and make you feel more energetic.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can tonify your muscles and help you feel stronger.
meanings.sent3: I tonify my morning routine with a refreshing cup of coffee to start the day with energy.
meanings.sent4: Laughter has the power to tonify the spirit and uplift the mood.
meanings.sent5: The warm sunlight seemed to tonify the flowers, making them bloom vibrantly.

meanings.sent1: A brisk walk in the fresh air can tonify your mind and improve focus.
meanings.sent2: Listening to uplifting music can tonify your spirit and boost your mood.
meanings.sent3: The energetic dance moves tonify the atmosphere, making everyone feel alive.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words tonify my determination, giving me the strength to persevere.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words tonify the audience, inspiring them to take action.

meanings.sent1: Adding extra support can tonify the structure of the building and make it more stable.
meanings.sent2: Regular practice can tonify your skills and make you more proficient.
meanings.sent3: The firm handshake tonifies the impression you make during a job interview.
meanings.sent4: Positive affirmations can tonify your self-confidence and make you feel more assured.
meanings.sent5: The team's unity tonifies their bond, making them stronger together.
